intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. setosifolium, commonly known as the hairy-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The subspecies is distinguished by its densely pubescent leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. This plant is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
